title: Centre for Population Change: Understanding Population Change in the 21st Century
abstractText:
The new ESRC Research Centre for Population Change (CPC) aims to improve our understanding of the key drivers and implications of population change within the UK The Centre is a joint initiative between the University of Southampton and a consortium of Scottish Universities in partnership with Office for National Statistics (ONS) and General Register Office for Scotland (GROS), and is directed by Professor Jane Falkingham (University of Southampton) and co-directed by Prof Maria Evandrou, Prof Sue Heath (both at Southampton) and Prof Paul Boyle (University of St Andrews).

The Centre's research focuses on the dynamic interconnections between the different demographic and the implications for policy and the community in the context of an ageing society. Ranging from in-depth qualitative studies of the processes underlying individual demographic behaviour through to complex statistical and economic modelling, the Centre's research brings methodological innovation to the study of population change in the UK.
